HIQA identified 65 children who were at risk of sexual abuse to Tusla who put actions in place to protect them. HIQA is satisfied that did happen

Tusla and Gardai are not sharing information on sexually abused children; "There is no agreed information sharing protocol to facilitate good sharing of relevant information between Tusla and gardai" – excellent informal sharing however
HIQA finds that children who have allegedly been sexually assaulted are left at risk by Tusla; - "there is an actual systems risk which places children at potential risk"

HIQA's report into Tusla was prompted by Katherine Zappone who was "Concerned at the apparent poor handling by Tusla" of info provided to it arising from McCabe case, which indicated a possible serious risk to the health of children - HIQA concurs https://t.co/XiBnYVmVz9
